{"step_by_step_thinking": "SD plasma treatment is known to effectively inactivate lipid-enveloped viruses, which include HIV, HBV, and HCV. Therefore, these viruses are unlikely to be transmitted through SD plasma transfusion. On the other hand, HAV is a non-lipid-enveloped virus, which means it is not affected by the SD treatment and could potentially be transmitted through SD plasma transfusion.", "answer_choice": "B"}
